citations.narrative:
A female dog and 4 of her nursing puppies were in an enclosure that measured 28.375'' by 21.8125'' for a total amount of
618.929 square inches of space. The female dog measured 18 inches. Her and her pups required 691.2 and were short
by 72.71 square inches of space.
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
Correct starting on 9/11/23.

The licensee does not have documentation of the results for the heartworm or fecal tests. Not being able to provide
documentation of these results doesn't ensure the tests were done and doesn't ensure the dogs are healthy and free of
the various parasites that they have been tested for. The licensee must keep documentation of all test results for all dogs.
Correct by 10/11/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
3.6(c)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A female dog and 4 of her nursing puppies were in an enclosure that measured 28.375'' by 21.8125'' for a total amount of 
618.929 square inches of space. The female dog measured 18 inches. Her and her pups required 691.2 and were short 
by 72.71 square inches of space. 
 
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It 
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee 
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space 
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
 
Correct starting on 9/11/23. 
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee does not have documentation of the results for the heartworm or fecal tests. Not being able to provide 
documentation of these results doesn't ensure the tests were done and doesn't ensure the dogs are healthy and free of 
the various parasites that they have been tested for. The licensee must keep documentation of all test results for all dogs. 
Correct by 10/11/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
